title: Gecko Moria is Actually Kozuki Moria from Wano
theory: In One Piece Chapter 1158's cover story, a grave for 'Kozuki Moria' is revealed in Wano Country's Ringo region. This person has several traits in common with Gecko Moria - same given name, being a pirate from the West Blue, and fighting Kaido in Ringo. The wordplay is significant: 'Gecko' is the Kozuki kanji phrase written in reverse, literally meaning 'moonlight.' This suggests Gecko Moria may actually be a member of the Kozuki clan who fought against Kaido to defend his village and was thought to have died, with no body recovered.

communityDiscussion: This theory gained significant traction after Chapter 1158's cover story revealed the Kozuki Moria grave. Fans have noted the clever wordplay with the names and the thematic connection between Moria's past and the Kozuki clan's resistance against Kaido. If true, this would make Moria potentially related to Oden, Momonosuke, and other Kozuki family members.

title: Moria Defeated Kaido in One of His Seven Losses
theory: It was stated that Kaido has lost seven times in his life. Some fans theorize that one of those defeats was at the hands of Gecko Moria during their battle in Wano. While Moria's crew was ultimately destroyed and he was defeated overall, he may have actually won an initial confrontation or battle against Kaido himself before being overwhelmed by the Beasts Pirates.

communityDiscussion: This theory attempts to reconcile Moria's past strength with Kaido's known defeats. Some fans believe Moria may have initially defeated Kaido in single combat before being overwhelmed by his crew, which would explain both Kaido's respect for strong opponents and Moria's current obsession with having an invulnerable zombie army rather than relying on living crew members.

title: Oars Jr. Was Searching for Moria to Avenge His Ancestor
theory: Little Oars Jr., who appears during the Marineford War as an ally of Whitebeard, may have had a secondary motivation beyond helping Ace - he might have been searching for Gecko Moria to avenge his ancestor Oars whose body was desecrated and turned into a zombie. This would add another layer to the Marineford conflict and explain Oars Jr.'s particular ferocity.

title: Moria May Join Cross Guild as Their Poneglyph Reader
theory: If Gecko Moria is confirmed to be from the Kozuki clan (as suggested by the Kozuki Moria grave), he would potentially have the ability to read Poneglyphs, as the Kozuki clan created them and passed down the knowledge of decoding them. This could lead him to join the Cross Guild, as they're the only major organization lacking a Poneglyph reader compared to other Emperor crews.

communityDiscussion: This theory builds on the Kozuki Moria theory and attempts to predict Moria's future role in the story. Fans note that Moria's desire for revenge against Kaido (established in Episode 350) could be reframed as reclaiming something stolen from him (home, honor, identity) if he's truly from Wano. The Cross Guild connection provides a potential path for Moria to remain relevant in the final saga while serving a practical purpose for a major faction.
